properties.name: Aug 1: Allston Celebration
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutAllston Street & Griggs Place, Boston, MATuesday August 1st at Allston Street & Griggs Place Allston, Ringer Park & Playground District Celebrations 6:30 pm - 8:00 pm Including free food, entertainment, and activities.

properties.name: Aug 1: Chinatown Celebration
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutOak Street & Harrison Avenue, Boston, MATuesday August 1St at Oak Street & Harrison Avenue Chinatown, Tai Tung Village District Celebration 4 pm - 6pm A cavalcade led by Mayor Thomas M. Menino and Acting Police Commissioner Albert Goslin will visit the site and present the Top Ten Neighborhood Watch Awards and Community Service Awards to resident recipients. Attendees will enjoy a lion dance, sausages, hotdogs, chips, ice cream, soft drinks and opportunities to get to know their neighbors.

properties.name: Aug 1: Coffee with the Chiefs, 10:30-11:30 am
properties.description: Posted by Nationalnightout The Pavillion at Fenway ParkTuesday August 1st at The Pavilion at Fenway Park Coffee With The Chiefs 10:30 am - 11:30 am Naming of Crime Fighter of the Year

properties.name: Aug 1: Dorchester Celebration
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutBetween Percival St. & Mt. Ida Road, Boston, MATuesday August 1St Between Percival Street & Mt. Ida Road Dorchester, Ronan Park District Celebration 4:00 - 8 pm A cavalcade led by Mayor Thomas M. Menino and Acting Police Commissioner Albert Goslin will visit the site and present the Top Ten Neighborhood Watch Awards and Community Service Awards to resident recipients. Attendees will enjoy performances by a local rap group, a local Vietnamese play group, a double-dutch jump rope exhibition, and a singing group. Hamburgers, hotdogs, chips, ice cream, and soft drinks will be served.

properties.name: Aug 1: East Boston Celebration
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutSummer St & New Street, Boston, MATuesday August 1St at Summer & New Streets East Boston, LoPresti Park District Celebration 4 pm - 7 pm Including free food, entertainment, and activities.

properties.name: Aug 1: Hands Across the River 11:30 am
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutMass Ave BridgeTuesday August 1st at the Mass Ave Bridge Hands Across The River at 11:30 am Boston and Cambridge co-host over 30 cities and towns to kick off National Night Out. The event is a symbolic gesture showing that communities working together can reduce crime and the fear of crime.

properties.name: Aug 1: South End Celebration
properties.description: Posted by NationalnightoutBetween Shawmut and Washington Streets, Boston, MATuesday August 1St Between Shawmut & Washington Streets South End, Ramsey Park District Celebration 4pm - 7 pm A cavalcade led by Mayor Thomas M. Menino and Acting Police Commissioner Albert Goslin will visit the site and present the Top Ten Neighborhood Watch Awards and Community Service Awards to resident recipients. Attendees will enjoy, entertainment, fresh corn on the cob served up by Haley House Café, snack, ice cream, refreshments, a basketball and baseball game, and opportunities to get to know their neighbors.

properties.name: July 29: 6-9 pm Meet and Greet, 10 pm-2 am Dance
properties.description: Posted by Nationalnightout87 West Newtown St, Boston, MASaturday July 29th at The Jorge Hernandez Cultural Center 87 West Newtown St. South End. Free. Peace is Coming, for Us by Us Meet and Greet 6 pm – 9 pm Free RSVP Requested A nourishing social gathering for unsung heroes organizing to empower peace featuring loungin’, food, music, ambiance, conversation, open share and woo-sah! Soul Revival Unsung Heroes 10 pm – 2 am 5.00 entrance fee A multicultural dance party celebrating the contributions of selfless community leaders.
